title: Just ONE .. More FIGHT .. And I'll Be HISTORY
body_text:
I've Got QUESTIONS, You've Got ANSWERS!
It's been an enduring, physical struggle the last half decade-plus. So brace yourself for an equally-challenging mental test during
ECD
's pre-match attraction
Trivia Contest
- only at
ECD
's 7th birthday party!
Luck Has It: SEVEN RAFFLE!
A mystery prize package is up for grabs and it may just have your name on it!
The Numerical Pinnacle: WHO'S #500?
ECD
needs just three more - who, if anyone, will become the  unprecedented
500th Player
?
"THE BIG ONE": Six-Person Showdown!
Every great court general has risen high above the occasion to capture the coveted victory. For those brave and fortunate souls, bragging rights for life indeed. But it remains that only an elite few have done so on the grandest, most crucial stage of all.
The magnificently star-studded, three-vs-three encounter at SEVEN is a rare, once-in-a-lifetime chance for those who have yet to taste such sweet triumph.
Undeniably, SEVEN will host "The Big One" as six of the game's most recognized figures -
MILLS, AVAKIAN, JACOBS, SMALLS, OBERTO, TURNER
- are carefully divided into two formidible squads, each with one goal in mind.
Travis MILLS
Former two-time season finale headliner "Maniac" Mills has virtually done it all, with just this one exception. His comedic, good-humored antics have yet to bring him that figurative trophy; will he be able to contain his contagious laugh long enough to grab the career-enhancing win?
ECD
Player #23
Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 2 | September 4, 2005
Notable Contest(s): Defeated at DODGEBALL XL versus Joey Kelly; also fought to a draw at DODGEBALL 150's "Battle of the Sexes" three-vs-three confrontation
Captains Record: 0-2-1.
Joey SMALLS
His showcases against Sascha Basista throughout the years were as memorable as they were hurtful. Unfortunately for this fun-loving legend, the accurately nicknamed "Eddie Gordo" remains without that prized brass ring. SEVEN is perhaps his final opportunity and bet that he will stop at nothing to attain it.
ECD
Player #218
Debut: DODGEBALL 65 | November 26, 2006
Notable Contest(s): Defeated at FAMILY AFFAIR III (2010) versus Sascha Basista
Captains Record: 1-4-0.
Kenny JACOBS
He's the resident newbie who quickly ascended the rungs of
ECD's
ladder. In his almost two-year journey, the all-around athletic all-star Jacobs earned a spot in the FAMILY AFFAIR spotlight in 2011, though his victory-seeking quest was ultimately denied. At SEVEN, his second go-around amidst the familiar atmosphere might just be his crowning achievement.
ECD
Player #462
Debut: 5 YEAR ANNIVERSARY (175) | September 11, 2010
Notable Contest(s): Defeated at FAMILY AFFAIR IV (2011) versus Bobby Vetrano
Record: 0-1-0.
Rob AVAKIAN
This rare, but certainly appreciated appearance at SEVEN couldn't be any more crucial for the formerly-known "Trenchcoat". While Avakian holds the most match victories amongst his captains counterparts, none of which have come at such a high-profile event. Will his unpredictable, offensive strategy lead him to the career defining moment he's yearned?
ECD
Player #60
Debut: DODGEBALL 8 | October 22, 2005
Notable Contest(s): Defeated in "The War To Settle The Scores", three-vs-three war at DODGEBALL CXV
Record: 2-3-0.
Dan TURNER
One of
ECD's
most controversial figures in all of its illustrious history. Orginally slated as one-half of the THREE YEAR ANNIVERSARY's main attraction eons ago, Turner, for reasons unknown, no-showed the historic event! This wouldn't be the first time he pulled the disappearance act either, a dubious legacy still conversed about to this very day. There is absolutely no question that this Pond Scum icon is indeed the "wild card" in SEVEN.
ECD
Player #117
Debut: DODGEBALL XXVIII | February 25, 2006
Notable Contest(s): SEVEN will be his first big-time main event
Record: 1-1-1.
Kelly OBERTO
This chick means business. Guaranteed,  her ultra-athletic background will be unleashed for the
ECD
community to witness and it won't be pretty. Arguably the most well-rounded competitor of the SEVEN cast, her lone defeat at the hands of
ECDElitist
Diana DiBuccio in July '11 will only add fuel to the fire.
ECD
Player #356
Debut: DODGEBALL 119 | December 29, 2007
Notable Contest(s): SEVEN will be her first big-time main event
Record: 0-1-0.
________________________________________
________________________
We've Done It, Again.
And Luck Had Nothing To Do With It.
SEVEN Magical Years Are Ours.
SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY
September 1, 2012 | 5:30PM
Ocean Road Park

It's been an enduring, physical struggle the last half decade-plus. So brace yourself for an equally-challenging mental test during ECD's pre-match attraction Trivia Contest - only at ECD's 7th birthday party!

A mystery prize package is up for grabs and it may just have your name on it!

The Numerical Pinnacle: WHO'S #500?
ECD needs just three more - who, if anyone, will become the unprecedented 500th Player?

"THE BIG ONE": Six-Person Showdown!
Every great court general has risen high above the occasion to capture the coveted victory. For those brave and fortunate souls, bragging rights for life indeed. But it remains that only an elite few have done so on the grandest, most crucial stage of all.
